title: Kirchhoff loop - graph of V along path ABCDA

content.question: The figure shows a circuit made from a battery and three identical long, thin cylinders that are made from the same resistive material. Four labeled points, at the corners of the circuit, are also indicated. Which of the following graphs best represents the electric potential as a function of position along the circuit loop? Each graph starts at Point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and traverses the circuit clockwise.

choices.label: The figure shows a graph of 2 line segments in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled Position Along Loop and the values A, B, C, D, and A are indicated at equal intervals. The vertical axis is labeled Electric Potential. There are 8 equally spaced vertical gridlines and 3 equally spaced horizontal gridlines. Four of the vertical gridlines ascend from B, C, D, and A, and the other four are at the midpoints between adjacent letters. The first line segment starts on the vertical axis at the point with coordinates A comma 3 units, moves down and to the right, and ends on the horizontal axis at the point with coordinates D comma zero. The second line segment begins where the first one ends, moves up and to the right, and ends at the point with coordinates A comma 1 unit.
